results.title: 10 Easy ways to lose your job
results.creator_credit: Reelizations, Donna Boundy and Tom Colello
results.brief_description: Short vignettes illustrate the most common mistakes young people make when they are new to the workforce. These include: calling into work sick at the last minute, chronic lateness, not following instructions and less devious forms of stealing such as taking goods and services from the store or office. There is also an emphasis on attitude and how this affects customer service.

results.title: 10 days of glory: the Gallipoli pilgrimage 1990
results.brief_description: Traces the events leading up to the visit by ANZAC veterans to Gallipoli for the 75th anniversary memorial service at Anzac Cove. Includes personal experiences of the diggers and some of their former enemies, and highlights from the Prime Minister’s speech at Lone Pine. Presented by Peter Couchman.

results.title: 10 = Ten
results.creator_credit: MK2 Productions, Marin Karmitz and Abbas Kiarostami
results.brief_description: In Abbas Kiarostami’s “Ten”, ten vignettes, set in a car, are linked by the presence of the driver - a young mother, struggling to juggle the needs of her estranged young son and of her new marriage. Each conversation is, in essence, a reflection upon the human condition, and the fraught process of communication. Whilst passengers include the driver’s sister, a broken-hearted friend, an old woman and a prostitute, the most fascinating passenger is the woman’s son. The audience pays witness to their fraught and burdened relationship and the stubborn inability of each to simply hear the other. Using digital technology, Kiarostami’s minimalist approach presents a complex prism of the delicately balanced place of women in Iranian society.

results.title: 1,001 noughts
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films, General Learning Corporation and Lauren Woodby
results.brief_description: An ancient Arabian story poses a problem. Magic carpets are used as weapons of war and, in order to determine how many each enemy has, the king has to solve the multiplication problem that gives this information. Previewing recommended for follow-up work for teachers. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
